title: [Question] External packages module requirement to work with Spack?
body:
Suppose I have following external module:

```
module show nix/bgq/cmake/3.3.2
-------------------------------------------------------------------
/gpfs-path-xxx//modules-bgq-lugano-all/nix/bgq/cmake/3.3.2:

module-whatis	 cmake for BGQ backend  generated by nix
prepend-path	 PATH /gpfs-path/store/636l7bvg95fvdyffddw8g94cxwsrb1v8-generated-env-module-cmake/bin
-------------------------------------------------------------------
```

Then I add entry in `packages.yaml` as :

```
    cmake:
        modules:
            cmake@3.3.2%xl@12.1 arch=bgq-cnk-ppc64: nix/bgq/cmake/3.3.2
        buildable: False
        version: [3.3.2]
```

While installation I see:

```
==> cmake@3.9.0 : generating module file
==> Error: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
```

Debug shows :

```
==> cmake@3.3.2 : generating module file
==> SKIP: shebang filtering [external package]
==> READ LOCK: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/spack_install/bgq/.spack-db/lock[0:0] [Acquiring]
==> READ LOCK: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/spack_install/bgq/.spack-db/lock[0:0] [Acquired]
==> READ LOCK: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/spack_install/bgq/.spack-db/lock[0:0] [Released]
==> 	WRITE : cmake@3.3.2%xl@12.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=bgq-cnk-ppc64 /gshkzty [/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/spack_modules/bgq/tcl/bgq-cnk-ppc64/cmake-3.3.2-xl-12.1-gshkzty]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/bin/spack", line 81, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 552, in main
    return _main(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 444, in _main
    return _invoke_spack_command(command, parser, args, unknown_args)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 355, in _invoke_spack_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 361, in install
    package.do_install(**kwargs)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1272, in do_install
    **kwargs
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1272, in do_install
    **kwargs
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1233, in do_install
    return self._process_external_package(explicit)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1175, in _process_external_package
    spack.hooks.post_install(self.spec)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/__init__.py", line 73, in __call__
    hook(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/module_file_generation.py", line 32, in post_install
    generator.write()
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/modules.py", line 380, in write
    env = inspect_path(self.spec.prefix)
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1364, in prefix
    return Prefix(spack.store.layout.path_for_spec(self))
  File "/gpfs-path/softwares/sources/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 127, in path_for_spec

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'
```

So are there any prerequisite for external modules to play nicely with Spack?

cc: @alalazo
